oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Freedom Sings - First Amendment Center program - 2017-03-28
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Freedom Sings performances celebrating the First Amendment co-hosted by the Country Music Hall of Fame and the First Amendment Center at the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on March 28, 2017. Hosted by Ken Paulson. Includes band members Seth Timbs, Jonell Mosser, Dez Dickerson and Bill Lloyd. Includes recorded audio excerpts.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ken Paulson; Seth Timbs; Jonell Mosser; Dez Dickerson; Bill Lloyd;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (21:55) Opening comments and introduction of Ken Paulson by Danielle Herbst / (23:42) Ken Paulson's opening comments and band introduction / (26:35) Performance of Revolution (Dez Dickerson-vocal) / (30:28) Paulson talks about revolution and social progress brought on by music / (34:00) Audio from interview with Janis Ian about writing the song Society's Child / (34:45) Performance of Society's Child (Jonell Mosser-vocal) / (36:50) Ken talks about new wave of songwriters and the writing of social songs / (37:36) Performance of Blowing In The Wind (Bill Lloyd-vocal) / (40:16) Ken talks about the lyrics of the Anti-War movement in the USA and the Kent State University shooting in 1970 / (44:41) Audio of interview with David Crosby / (45:23) Performance of Ohio (Bill Lloyd-vocal) / (47:58) Ken talks about Earth Day and the budding environmental effort / (48:41) Performance of Big Yellow Taxi (Jonell Mosser-vocal) /

(50:47) Ken talks about John Prine and the use of the song Paradise / (51:46) Performance of Paradise (Seth Timbs-vocal) / (54:15) Ken talks about popular culture and it's portrayal of women / (55:36) Performance of Johnny Get Angry (Jonell Mosser-vocal) / (57:28) Ken talks about sexist songs / (58:29) Performance of (You're) Having My Baby (Dez Dickerson-vocal) / (01:00:47) Ken and Jonell talk about the previous song lyrics / (01:01:44) Ken talks about what happens when you use music to make a point / (01:03:06) Performance of I Am Woman (Jonell Mosser-vocal) / (01:05:06) Ken talks about the women's rights movement and the driving force behind the censorship of music / (01:06:33) Performance of Wake Up Little Suzie (Bill Lloyd and Seth Timbs) / (01:07:54) Ken talks about the irony of which songs get banned and which songs don't and the recording of the Kingsmen Louie Louie / (01:11:07) Plays excerpt of recording of the Kingsmen's Louie Louie /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Paulson, Ken; Timbs, Seth; Mosser, Jonell; Lloyd, Bill; Dickerson, Dez; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
